messages.message: Hello France! Just opening up communication. Hope we have a good game together
messages.input: Message from GERMANY:'Hello France! Just opening up communication. Hope we have a good game together'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: F BRE - MAO, A PAR - BUR, A MAR S A PAR - BUR. Should I trust GERMANY?
messages.output: You should trust the message from GERMANY. The initial friendly communication without any specific strategic demands indicates a positive and open approach towards cooperation. It would be a good opportunity to establish a foundation for trust and potentially explore alliances throughout the game.

messages.message: Hi Germany, good to talk to you. Were you hoping for particular command centers in the low lands? I'm considering going for belgium

messages.message: Based on what I've heard so far (I have a suspicion England might try for either Holland or Belgium). I'm gonna go for a pretty conservative start (Kiel --> Denmark, Berlin --> Kiel, Munich Hold). Do you want to agree that I take Holland and you take Belgium, then see where we go from there?
messages.input: Message from GERMANY:'Based on what I've heard so far (I have a suspicion England might try for either Holland or Belgium). I'm gonna go for a pretty conservative start (Kiel --> Denmark, Berlin --> Kiel, Munich Hold). Do you want to agree that I take Holland and you take Belgium, then see where we go from there?'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: F BRE - MAO, A PAR - BUR, A MAR S A PAR - BUR. Should I trust GERMANY?
messages.output: You should trust the message from GERMANY. The suggestion to divide the Low Countries and the transparency about their planned moves indicate a willingness to establish a clear agreement and build a foundation for future collaboration. Proceed with the agreement while staying vigilant and ensuring that the arrangement benefits your strategic position.

messages.message: I think that's fine with me.

messages.message: You had assured me Munich would hold but then I find out it moves to Bur instead.
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'You had assured me Munich would hold but then I find out it moves to Bur instead.'.

messages.message: I would've liked to work together and at least take out england quickly
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'I would've liked to work together and at least take out england quickly'.

messages.message: But I see you have other plans
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'But I see you have other plans'.

messages.message: So, given the moves of England this Fall, it seems clear that they're attacking both of us. I know I've been... aggressive to you in the past, and I know that chances are you won't believe me or agree to work with me, but if you hear me out we both can gain from this (and utterly destroy England in the process). I'll retreat from Burgundy this Spring, and I'll agree to not invade any more territories of yours until all of England is destroyed. I'm assuming you're going to build a fleet in Brest, and if you do so and move Bre --> Eng in the spring it would cut any support that fleet could provide and I can kick England out of the North Sea. From there I can help support you in to the English Channel or we could work to convoy an army into the British Isles in the next few years. I hope you consider.
messages.input: Message from GERMANY:'So, given the moves of England this Fall, it seems clear that they're attacking both of us. I know I've been... aggressive to you in the past, and I know that chances are you won't believe me or agree to work with me, but if you hear me out we both can gain from this (and utterly destroy England in the process). I'll retreat from Burgundy this Spring, and I'll agree to not invade any more territories of yours until all of England is destroyed. I'm assuming you're going to build a fleet in Brest, and if you do so and move Bre --> Eng in the spring it would cut any support that fleet could provide and I can kick England out of the North Sea. From there I can help support you in to the English Channel or we could work to convoy an army into the British Isles in the next few years. I hope you consider.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message from GERMANY. Their detailed plan and proposal for collaboration against the common threat of England show a willingness to reconcile past aggressions and prioritize mutual strategic gains. Considering their commitment and outlined strategy, cooperating with Germany could lead to significant advantages in the game.

messages.message: I am considering it. England in the channel was not great
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'I am considering it. England in the channel was not great'.
